\section{Natural Transformations}

\subsection{Definition}
For a natural transformation $\alpha : F \Rightarrow G$ with functors
$F, G: C \to D$ between categories $C,\ D$:
\parencite{fong:7sketches}
% https://q.uiver.app/?q=WzAsMixbMCwwLCJDIl0sWzEsMCwiRCJdLFswLDEsIkciLDIseyJjdXJ2ZSI6Mn1dLFswLDEsIkYiLDAseyJjdXJ2ZSI6LTJ9XSxbMywyLCJcXGFscGhhIiwwLHsic2hvcnRlbiI6eyJzb3VyY2UiOjIwLCJ0YXJnZXQiOjIwfX1dXQ==
\[\begin{tikzcd}
	C & D
	\arrow[""{name=0, anchor=center, inner sep=0}, "G"', curve={height=12pt}, from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow[""{name=1, anchor=center, inner sep=0}, "F", curve={height=-12pt}, from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow["\alpha", shorten <=3pt, shorten >=3pt, Rightarrow, from=1, to=0]
\end{tikzcd}\]
%
\begin{itemize}
  \item $c$-component of $\alpha$, between functor images\\
    $\alpha_c : F(c) \to G(c),\ \forall (c\in \mathrm{ob}_C)$
  \item Naturality condition\\
    $\alpha_d \circ F(f) = G(f) \circ \alpha_c,\ \forall (f:c \to d$ in $C$),
    which is the same as saying the following diagram
    commutes\footnote{parallel morphisms i.e. those with the same
    source and target, are equal}
    % https://q.uiver.app/?q=WzAsNCxbMCwwLCJGKGMpIl0sWzEsMCwiRihkKSJdLFswLDEsIkcoYykiXSxbMSwxLCJHKGQpIl0sWzAsMiwiXFxhbHBoYV9jIl0sWzEsMywiXFxhbHBoYV9kIl0sWzAsMSwiRihmKSJdLFsyLDMsIkcoZikiLDJdXQ==
    \[\begin{tikzcd}
      {F(c)} & {F(d)} \\
      {G(c)} & {G(d)}
      \arrow["{\alpha_c}", from=1-1, to=2-1]
      \arrow["{\alpha_d}", from=1-2, to=2-2]
      \arrow["{F(f)}", from=1-1, to=1-2]
      \arrow["{G(f)}"', from=2-1, to=2-2]
    \end{tikzcd}\]
    e.g.
    % https://q.uiver.app/?
    \[\begin{tikzcd}
      & C & D \\
      &&& {F(a)} & {F(b)} \\
      a & b & 1 &&& 6 \\
      &&& {G(a)} & {G(b)}
      \arrow["g", from=3-3, to=2-4]
      \arrow["h"', from=3-3, to=4-4]
      \arrow["{\alpha_a}", from=2-4, to=4-4]
      \arrow["{\alpha_b}"', from=2-5, to=4-5]
      \arrow["{F(f)}", from=2-4, to=2-5]
      \arrow["{G(f)}"', from=4-4, to=4-5]
      \arrow["i", from=2-5, to=3-6]
      \arrow["j"', from=4-5, to=3-6]
      \arrow["f", from=3-1, to=3-2]
      \arrow[color={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-12pt}, dotted, from=3-1, to=2-4]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=3-2, to=2-5]
      \arrow[color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=12pt}, dotted, from=3-1, to=4-4]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dotted, from=3-2, to=4-5]
      \arrow["F"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-18pt}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
      \arrow["G"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=18pt}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
    \end{tikzcd}\]
  \item Natural isomorphism\\
    if $\forall (c\in \mathrm{ob}_C.\ \alpha_c)$ is an isomorphism, then $\alpha$ is
    called a natural isomorphism
\end{itemize}

\subsection{Important Natural Transformations}
\begin{itemize}
  \item Cone:\\
    For categories $C,D$ and a functor $F: C\to D$, the cone over $F$ is the
    natural transformation between the constant functor $\Delta d$ for some
    object in $D$ and $F$.\\
    e.g.
    % https://q.uiver.app/?
    \[\begin{tikzcd}
      && C & D \\
      &&&& d \\
      \bullet && \bullet & \bullet && \bullet \\
      \\
      \bullet && \bullet & \bullet && \bullet
      \arrow[color={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-12pt}, dotted, from=3-1, to=2-5]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-6pt}, dotted, from=3-3, to=2-5]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-24pt}, dotted, from=5-3, to=2-5]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-30pt}, dotted, from=5-1, to=2-5]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=12pt}, dotted, from=3-1, to=3-4]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=-12pt}, dotted, from=3-3, to=3-6]
      \arrow[from=2-5, to=3-4]
      \arrow[from=2-5, to=3-6]
      \arrow["\alpha"{pos=0.1}, from=2-5, to=5-4]
      \arrow[from=2-5, to=5-6]
      \arrow[from=3-1, to=3-3]
      \arrow[from=3-1, to=5-1]
      \arrow[from=5-1, to=5-3]
      \arrow[from=3-3, to=5-3]
      \arrow[from=3-4, to=5-4]
      \arrow[from=3-4, to=3-6]
      \arrow[from=3-6, to=5-6]
      \arrow[from=5-4, to=5-6]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=-12pt}, dotted, from=5-3, to=5-6]
      \arrow[color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=12pt}, dotted, from=5-1, to=5-4]
      \arrow["{\Delta d}"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-18pt}, from=1-3, to=1-4]
      \arrow["F"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=18pt}, from=1-3, to=1-4]
    \end{tikzcd}\]
  \item Cocone:\\
    For categories $C,D$ and a functor $F: C\to D$, the cocone under $F$ is the
    natural transformation between $F$ and the constant functor $\Delta d$ for some
    object in $D$.\\
    e.g.
    % https://q.uiver.app/?
    \[\begin{tikzcd}
      && C & D \\
      \bullet && \bullet & \bullet && \bullet \\
      \\
      \bullet && \bullet & \bullet && \bullet \\
      &&&& d
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=30pt}, dotted, from=2-1, to=5-5]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=24pt}, dotted, from=2-3, to=5-5]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=6pt}, dotted, from=4-3, to=5-5]
      \arrow[color={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=12pt}, dotted, from=4-1, to=5-5]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=12pt}, dotted, from=2-1, to=2-4]
      \arrow[color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=-12pt}, dotted, from=2-3, to=2-6]
      \arrow["\alpha"{pos=0.9}, from=2-4, to=5-5]
      \arrow[from=2-6, to=5-5]
      \arrow[from=4-4, to=5-5]
      \arrow[from=4-6, to=5-5]
      \arrow[from=2-1, to=2-3]
      \arrow[from=2-1, to=4-1]
      \arrow[from=4-1, to=4-3]
      \arrow[from=2-3, to=4-3]
      \arrow[from=2-4, to=4-4]
      \arrow[from=2-4, to=2-6]
      \arrow[from=2-6, to=4-6]
      \arrow[from=4-4, to=4-6]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=-12pt}, dotted, from=4-3, to=4-6]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=12pt}, dotted, from=4-1, to=4-4]
      \arrow["F"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=-18pt}, from=1-3, to=1-4]
      \arrow["{\Delta d}"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=18pt}, from=1-3, to=1-4]
    \end{tikzcd}\]
\end{itemize}
